title: Dividing with a Complex Number
text: In normal synthetic division, we use a real number as the divisor, but when we have a complex number like $$x-i$$, we perform synthetic division similarly, but we use the complex number $$k=i$$ as the root. So, for the division of (x+1)/(x-1)​, we will divide using $$k=i$$, where i is the imaginary unit.
